LanguageData.ForceOnlySelectedTooltip:
If enabled, ALL existing/vanilla gear will be stripped before applying your custom gear. This ensures the pawn ONLY wears what you specify here, preventing mixed vanilla/custom loadouts.
Recommended: ON for total control.
LanguageData.WeightMechanicsTooltip: Weight Mechanics: In RimWorld, gear weight acts as a selection weight, not a guarantee. Higher-weight equipment will be prioritized for wearing.

LanguageData.WikiMascotTip: Slipin' Coati - Click to view on Steam Workshop
LanguageData.Wiki_Principles_Content:
[Core Principles]
This mod uses Harmony's Postfix patch to intercept the PawnGenerator.GeneratePawn method, intervening immediately after the game generates a pawn to apply custom gear configurations.
[Technical Implementation]
• Interception Timing: Harmony's Postfix patch triggers immediately after the vanilla GeneratePawn method completes • Override Logic: The mod clears vanilla-generated gear based on configuration and applies custom settings • Scope: Only affects newly generated pawns (new raids, caravans, reinforcements, settlement defenders) • Data Persistence: All configurations are saved in the save file's game component and don't transfer between saves
[Gear Pool System]
Each pawn kind has a set of gear tags that the game uses to select equipment from the item library. Gear tags determine which items can be used by that pawn kind.
• Simple Mode: Adjust weights for different categories (weapons/armor/clothing) to influence random probability • Advanced Mode: Directly specify specific items, bypassing the random pool • Weight Mechanics: RimWorld's weights are "selection weights" rather than "guaranteed picks" - higher weight means higher probability but not 100%
[Budget Limits]
Each pawn kind has preset apparel budget (ApparelMoney) and weapon budget (WeaponMoney). The system decides whether to generate an item based on these budgets.
• Default Behavior: Items exceeding budget are skipped • ForceIgnore Option: Ignores budget limits and forces all configured gear (may create "god-tier" characters) • Recommendation: Keep budget limits for normal gameplay; enable ForceIgnore for creative mode or testing
[Body Part Conflicts]
RimWorld's apparel system is based on body part coverage - only one apparel item can cover the same body part.
• Detection Mechanism: Uses ApparelUtility.HasPartsToWear to check if body parts are occupied • Typical Conflicts: Two bulletproof vests cannot be worn simultaneously • Resolution: Enabling ForceIgnore attempts to force override conflicting gear
[Advanced Mode Details]
Advanced mode provides fine-grained control:
1. Specific Items Abandon random pools and directly specify equipment. The system strictly follows configuration without randomness.
2. Material Override Force equipment to use specific materials like steel, plasteel, devilstrand, etc. Leaving empty uses game defaults.
3. Quality Override Set equipment quality range from awful to legendary. Quality directly affects stats and market value.
4. Color Customization Use the color picker to customize apparel colors, creating unified faction visual styles. Colors affect textile display.
5. Style Override Supports Ideology DLC style overrides, allowing specific religious/ideological apparel styles.
6. Selection Mode • AlwaysTake: Equipment always appears on the character • RandomChance: Randomly decides based on set probability • FromPool: Randomly selects one from specified item pool
7. Forced Hediffs Force-add health states to generated units like bionic limbs, implants, addictions, diseases, etc.
8. Item Pool System (Pool) Group items into 4 different pools, each with independent weights. The system randomly draws from pools based on weights.
LanguageData.Wiki_Terminology_Content:
[Core Concepts]
PawnKind Definition: A pawn kind definition describing a character type (e.g., Pirate Gunner, Tribal Warrior). Layman's Terms: Think of it as a "class" or "template" - each PawnKind determines base stats, gear preferences, skill levels, etc.
Faction Definition: A faction consisting of multiple pawn kinds. Layman's Terms: The various factions in the game like pirates, tribals, empire, player colony. Each has diplomatic relations, tech levels, and pawn kind compositions.
[Gear-Related Terms]
Gear Tag Definition: Equipment tags used to mark which items can be used by which pawn kinds. Layman's Terms: Like product category tags such as "military", "tribal", "noble". Pawn kinds use these tags to determine available equipment.
ApparelMoney (Apparel Budget) Definition: Maximum silver value a pawn kind can spend on apparel when generating. Layman's Terms: The character's "shopping budget" - items exceeding budget won't be purchased/generated.
WeaponMoney (Weapon Budget) Definition: Maximum silver value a pawn kind can spend on weapons when generating. Layman's Terms: Same as above but specifically for weapons.
[Selection Mode Terms]
Selection Mode Definition: Rules determining how gear is selected.
• AlwaysTake Definition: Equipment always appears on the character. Layman's Terms: 100% generation, no randomness.
• RandomChance Definition: Randomly decides based on set probability. Layman's Terms: Roll the dice - 50% chance is like flipping a coin.
• FromPool Definition: Randomly selects one from specified item pool (Pool 1-4). Layman's Terms: Draw one from a preset "lottery pool".
[Advanced Settings Terms]
Force Ignore Definition: Force ignore budget limits and body part conflicts. Layman's Terms: Ignore all rules and force all configured gear. May create "god-tier" characters but can cause issues.
Force Naked Definition: Strip all apparel when generating. Layman's Terms: Generate the character naked, then only equip what you specify.
Force Only Selected Definition: All vanilla/existing gear is stripped before applying custom gear. Layman's Terms: Strip first, then equip only what you specified - prevents vanilla/custom gear mixing.
Biocode Definition: Biocoded weapons bound to specific characters. Layman's Terms: Weapons have a "DNA lock" - only the specific character can use them, others get mood debuffs.
[Item Property Terms]
Material Definition: The crafting material of equipment. Common Materials: Cloth, leather, steel, plasteel, uranium, devilstrand, gold, etc. Effect: Material determines protection values, durability, weight, and appearance.
Quality Definition: Equipment quality level. Range: Awful → Poor → Normal → Good → Excellent → Masterwork → Legendary Effect: Quality directly affects equipment stats and market value. Legendary quality can be 2-3x better than awful.
Stuff (Material Items) Definition: Material items that can be used to craft equipment. Layman's Terms: Cloth for clothing, metal plates for armor, etc.
[Health State Terms]
Hediff (Health State) Definition: Any health-related state on a character. Categories: • Implants: Bionic limbs, organ replacements • Addictions: Addictions, tolerances • Diseases: Infections, plagues, cancers • Injuries: Cuts, burns, bruises • Other: Pregnancy, age-related degradation, etc.
Severity Definition: Intensity level of a Hediff. Effect: Disease severity determines symptom severity, addiction severity determines effect strength.
[Pawn Group Terms]
PawnGroupKind (Group Type) Definition: Determines the purpose of this group in the game.
• Combat: For raids, sieges, and other combat scenarios • Trader: For caravan generation, must include traders • Settlement: For faction settlement defenders • Peaceful: For peaceful visitors, travelers
Commonality (Spawn Weight) Definition: Relative probability of this group being selected. Layman's Terms: Higher weight means this group appears more frequently.
Points Definition: Limits the maximum combat power points of this group. Layman's Terms: Controls group strength - higher points allow stronger characters.
[Other Terms]
DefName (Definition Name) Definition: Unique identifier used internally by the game. Layman's Terms: Like an ID number - each Def has a unique string like "Pirate", "TribalWarrior".
TechLevel (Tech Level) Definition: Technology level of items or factions. Levels: Neolithic → Medieval → Industrial → Spacer → Ultra Effect: Determines which equipment can be used - high-tech gear won't appear in low-tech factions.
Xenotype (Xenotype) Definition: Genetically modified human subspecies introduced by Biotech DLC. Examples: Sanguophages, pigskins, mole people, etc. Each has unique genetic traits.
LanguageData.Wiki_Workflow_Content:
[Quick Start]
This chapter guides you from zero to using the mod, covering the complete workflow from creating presets to exporting and sharing.
[Step 1: Create Preset]
Presets are the basic containers for saving configurations. All gear configurations must be saved in a preset.
Steps: 1. Open Mod Settings (Main Menu → Options → Mod Settings → Faction Gear Customizer) 2. Click "Preset Manager" button 3. Click "Create New Preset" 4. Enter preset name (e.g., "My Custom Configuration") 5. Optional: Add description for future identification
Tip: When using for the first time, create a "Backup Preset" to save vanilla settings for recovery.
[Step 2: Select Faction]
The left list shows all available factions.
• Faction Categories: Humanlike factions, animal factions, mechanoid factions, others • Color Coding: Gray indicates faction doesn't exist in current game • Search: Use search box to quickly locate factions
Action: Click faction name to expand and view all pawn kinds under that faction.
[Step 3: Select Pawn Kind]
The pawn kind list shows all PawnKinds under the selected faction.
• Icon: Shows default appearance of this pawn kind • Name: Display name of the pawn kind • DefName: Internal identifier
Action: Click pawn kind name to enter edit interface.
[Step 4: Configure Gear - Simple Mode]
Simple mode is suitable for quick adjustments through the weight system to influence random probability.
Interface: • Weapons: Ranged weapons, melee weapons • Armor: Helmets, bulletproof vests and other protective gear • Clothing: Shirts, pants, coats, etc. • Others: Accessories, belts, etc.
How to: 1. Click "Add" button to open item selector 2. Check items you want this pawn kind to use 3. Adjust slider to set weight (0-100) 4. Higher weight means higher probability of being selected
Budget Settings: • Drag budget slider to adjust total budget • Low budget may prevent some gear from generating • Recommend setting based on faction tech level
[Step 5: Configure Gear - Advanced Mode]
Advanced mode provides fine-grained control for players with specific needs.
Switch: Click "Simple/Advanced" button at top
Advanced Mode Features:
1. Specific Items • Click "Add Weapon" or "Add Apparel" • Search and select specific items in the selector • Can add multiple items to form a list
2. Set Item Properties Click "Edit" icon on right side of item: • Material: Force specific material (empty for random) • Quality: Set quality range (e.g., Good-Excellent) • Color: Use color picker to customize • Selection Mode: AlwaysTake/RandomChance/FromPool
3. Configure Item Pools • Pool 1-4: Four independent item pools • Each pool can contain multiple items • Set pool weights to affect draw probability
4. Add Hediffs (Health States) • Click "Add Forced Hediff" • Select Hediff to add (e.g., bionic leg, addiction) • Set Severity • Set Chance
5. Advanced Options • ForceNaked: Generate naked • ForceOnlySelected: Only use specified gear • ForceIgnore: Ignore budget and conflict limits
[Step 6: Real-time Preview]
Preview lets you see modification effects before saving.
How to: 1. Click "Preview" button to open preview window 2. Window shows generated character appearance and gear list 3. Click "Rebuild" to refresh preview 4. Adjust seed value to see different random results
Note: Preview only works in-game, limited functionality in main menu.
[Step 7: Batch Operations]
Batch apply lets you quickly apply current configuration to multiple pawn kinds.
How to: 1. Click "Batch Apply" button 2. Select target pawn kinds in popup window 3. Can "Select All" or check individually 4. Click confirm to apply
Use Cases: • Unify uniform style across entire faction • Quickly configure similar pawn kinds
[Step 8: Save Changes]
All modifications must be saved to take effect.
How to: 1. Click "Save changes to current game" button 2. Changes take effect immediately, no restart needed 3. Newly generated characters will use new configuration
Important Notes: • Modifications only affect newly generated characters • Existing characters are not affected • Recommend previewing before saving
[Step 9: Preset Management]
Presets can be exported for sharing or imported for use.
Export Preset: 1. Select preset to share in Preset Manager 2. Click "Export" button 3. Preset data copied to clipboard 4. Send string to friends or post to community
Import Preset: 1. Click "Import from Clipboard" 2. Paste preset string 3. Confirm import
Notes: • Imported presets may depend on specific mods • Missing mods will show items as missing • Recommend checking compatibility after import
[Step 10: Pawn Group Editing (Advanced)]
Pawn groups determine how factions generate various unit combinations in the game.
Access: 1. Select faction then click "Pawn Groups" tab 2. View all group configurations for this faction
Group Types: • Combat: Combat groups for raids • Trader: Caravan groups, must include traders • Settlement: Settlement defenders • Peaceful: Peaceful visitors
Edit Points: • Commonality: Higher weight means appears more frequently • Points: Controls group strength • Options: General combat personnel • Traders/Carriers/Guards: Specific roles
Warnings: • Deleting all Combat groups prevents raid generation • Trader groups without traders cause caravan generation failures
[Complete Workflow Example]
Scenario: Make all Empire soldiers wear red power armor
1. Create preset "Empire Red Legion" 2. Select "Empire" faction 3. Select "Empire Soldier" pawn kind 4. Switch to Advanced Mode 5. Add power armor, set color to red 6. Add power helmet, set color to red 7. Set selection mode to AlwaysTake 8. Click Batch Apply, select all Empire combat pawn kinds 9. Preview to confirm effect 10. Save changes 11. Export preset to share with friends
LanguageData.Wiki_Notes_Content:
[Important Information]
This chapter covers essential information for using this mod, including effect mechanisms, compatibility, common issues and solutions.
[Modification Effect Mechanism]
When Changes Take Effect: • Changes take effect immediately after saving, no restart needed • Only affects newly generated characters (new raids, caravans, settlement defenders, etc.) • Characters already on the map are not affected • Units already generated in ongoing quests won't change
When Changes Don't Take Effect: • Existing characters and animals • Player colony's starting characters (unless regenerated) • Some special event-generated units (depends on event implementation)
How to Verify Effect: • Use preview function to see generation results • Wait for new raids/caravans and observe gear • Use dev mode to force generate for testing
[Preset Management Notes]
Role of Presets: • Presets are containers for configurations - all modifications are saved in the active preset • Switching presets loads different configuration sets • Presets don't affect each other
Important Reminders: • Deleting a preset will NOT rollback changes already saved to the game • Applied configurations persist even if the preset is deleted • To restore vanilla, you must manually reset or load a "vanilla" preset • Recommend regularly exporting presets for backup
Save Independence: • Each save has independent configurations • Configurations don't auto-sync when switching saves • First time entering a save will prompt to select a preset
[Common Issues & Solutions]
Issue 1: Gear not generating as expected Possible Causes: • Budget limits: Gear value exceeds pawn kind budget • Part conflicts: Body parts already occupied by other gear • Tech limits: Gear tech level higher than faction • Race limits: Some races cannot wear specific gear
Solutions: • Enable ForceIgnore option • Check and adjust budget settings • Confirm gear matches pawn kind tech level • Check race apparel compatibility
Issue 2: Some items cannot be selected Possible Causes: • Items disabled by other mods • Items require specific DLC (Ideology, Biotech) • Item tech level too high • Items are quest/event exclusive
Solutions: • Check mod load order • Confirm required DLCs are installed • Use search function to confirm item exists
Issue 3: Game lag or crashes Possible Causes: • Large number of configured items causing complex generation calculations • Conflicts with other gear modification mods • Circular references or invalid configurations
Solutions: • Reduce number of gear items per pawn kind • Check mod compatibility • Reset configuration and troubleshoot step by step
Issue 4: Color/style not applying Possible Causes: • Some items don't support dyeing (specific materials) • Ideology styles require corresponding DLC • Style incompatible with item
Solutions: • Confirm item supports dyeing • Check DLC installation status • Try other style options
[Advanced Option Warnings]
ForceIgnore: • Completely ignores budget limits • Attempts to force override body part conflicts • May create "god-tier" characters, breaking game balance • Recommend only for creative mode or testing
ForceNaked: • Strips all vanilla apparel • If subsequent configuration is incomplete, character may actually be naked • Ensure sufficient alternative gear is configured
ForceOnlySelected: • Removes all vanilla gear • If custom list is empty, character will have no gear • Recommend enabling for total control
[Compatibility Notes]
Fully Compatible: • Combat Extended (CE): Ammo system works normally • Humanoid Alien Races: Alien race gear works normally • Vanilla Expanded series: All VE gear available • Ideology DLC: Style system fully supported • Biotech DLC: Gene and xenotype system supported
Known Limitations: • Some mods that completely overhaul gear systems may conflict • Dynamic gear generation mods may produce unexpected results • Other mods that modify PawnKindDef may overwrite each other
Recommended Mod Load Order: 1. Harmony 2. Core 3. Other large mods (like CE) 4. Faction Gear Customizer 5. Small patch mods
[Performance Optimization Tips]
Avoid Performance Issues: • Don't make gear lists too long per pawn kind (recommend <50 items) • Avoid complex rules for large numbers of pawn kinds simultaneously • Use item pools reasonably instead of specifying each item individually • Regularly clean up unused presets
Large Mod Pack Users: • First load may take longer to build caches • Item selector may have brief delay when opening • Previewing many pawn kinds may lag
[Backup & Recovery]
Recommended Backup Strategy: 1. Export "vanilla configuration" preset before first use 2. Export current preset before major modifications 3. Regularly backup entire save files 4. Test compatibility before sharing presets
Recovery Methods: • Load backup preset • Reset specific faction/pawn kind • Complete reset of all configurations
[Multiplayer & Sharing]
Sharing Presets: • Exported preset strings contain all configurations • Recipients need same mod environment • Recommend sharing mod list together
Multiplayer: • Host configuration determines generation rules • Clients don't need this mod (host only) • Ensure all players use same configuration version
[Developer & Debug]
Dev Mode Features: • Force generate specific pawn kinds for testing • View detailed generation logs • Modify configuration in real-time and observe effects
Debug Tips: • Use preview function for quick verification • Increase complexity gradually to troubleshoot • Check game logs for error information
[Best Practices]
Beginner Recommendations: 1. Start with simple mode to familiarize with weight system 2. Modify one pawn kind first, observe effects 3. Create backup preset before large-scale modifications 4. Preview frequently to verify configuration
Advanced Tips: 1. Use item pools to create random but themed configurations 2. Combine with Hediffs to create unique pawn kinds (e.g., all bionic) 3. Use batch apply to quickly unify faction style 4. Create different presets for different game stages
Creative Playstyles: • "Steel Legion" - All power armor • "Uniform Faction" - Unified apparel colors • "Special Forces" - All carrying specific weapons • "Future Warriors" - All bionic enhanced
[Technical Support]
Troubleshooting Steps: 1. Confirm mod is latest version 2. Check if required mods are missing 3. Try resetting configuration to see if issue disappears 4. Check game logs for error information 5. Submit issue report on Steam Workshop or GitHub
[Support Channels]
Click the links below for help or to report issues:
• Steam Workshop Page https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3670833973
• GitHub Repository https://github.com/yancy22737-sudo/FactionGearCustomizer
• QQ Group (Player community and technical discussion) Group ID: 984338429
